alert.note: Alert for Northeast Bighorn Mountains; Sheridan Foothills (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 09 at 8:31PM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHEASTERN BIG HORN AND NORTH CENTRAL SHERIDAN COUNTIES THROUGH 900 PM MDT... At 828 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles north of Dayton, or 21 miles northwest of Sheridan, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Half inch hail, wind gusts 40 to 45 mph and heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Heavy rainfall will cause a dramatic reduction in visibility and quick ponding of water on roadways. Locations impacted include... Ranchester, Dayton, Parkman, and Wyola. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
